Threats.malicious action: Personal data is kept stored more than the time necessary for the purposes by ACME.
Due to over-privileged or inadequate controls, insiders (i.e., a medical practitioner or an ACME’s staff) modify patients’ data or disclose by mistake.
Patients and their personal data can re-identify in de-identified data sets by outsiders malicious. (ACME data set)
Attackers can disrupt the communication channel between patients and the healthcare service provider in order to prevent data from being upload to the server.
ACME does not implement a procedure (technical and/or processes) that allows the patients to rectify, erase or block individual data.
